com.barrysheehan.www

Class ConfigurationInteractable

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.barrysheehan.www.ConfigurationInteractable
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Interactable

    public class ConfigurationInteractable
extends java.lang.Object
implements Interactable
    Prompts the user for input and uses that input to configure the supplied TextSimplifier object.

    Prompts user to enter the path to a dictionary file and the path to a word list file. These are used to configure the supplied TextSimplifier's thesaurus.

    Employs while loops to continue to prompt user to enter a file path until a suitable one has been entered.

    Since:
    1.8
    See Also:
    Interactable

      • execute

        public void execute()
        Updates the values of dictionaryFile and wordListFile in TextSimplifier ts and initialises it with a new Thesaurus.

        Once the TextSimplifier's dictionaryFile and wordListFile variables have been set with paths to two files, the TextSimplifier's init() method is called, creating a new Thesaurus object and configuring the TextSimplifier to use it.

        The method checks whether:

        • The value of newDictionaryFile matches the path to the current dictionary file
        • The value of newWordListFile matches the path to the current word list file
        • The TextSimplifier ts has been previously configured, based on its configured instance variable

        If both file paths are the same as the ones already configured, the method exits without configuring ts. However, if ts has not previously been configured, the method ensures that it is configured before the method exits. This means that a new Thesaurus is not created if it doesn't need to be and that the current TextSimplifier is always configured when the method exits.

        Specified by:
        execute in interface Interactable
